definition: to see through something at first glance (idiom)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread

sentences.english: He thought he could fool people with transparent deceptions.
sentences.chinese: 他以为他能用那些可以一眼看穿的鬼把戏愚弄人。

sentences.english: Phoebe sees right through it but promises not to tell Monica.
sentences.chinese: 菲比一眼看穿，但答应不告诉莫妮卡。

definition: see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to penetrate/to see through
to understand thoroughly/to see beyond the facade/to see through (sb)
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
one word says it all (idiom)/to hit the nail on the head/to be pithy and correct
to expose/to uncover
to puncture/to lay bear or expose (lies etc)
to see everything clearly
to clearly understand
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
to estimate/to surmise/to appraise
to lay bare in a few words/to expose with a word/to point out bluntly
to uncover
to surmise/to conjecture
to hit the nail on the head/to predict correctly
